text: Regulation of <extra_id_0> interleukin-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production by glucocorticoids in human monocytes : the mechanism of action depends on the activation signal .

text: Glucocorticoids are known to downregulate <extra_id_0> interleukin-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production in monocytic cells by two different mechanims : direct inhibition of the gene transcription and destabilization of the preformed <extra_id_0> interleukin-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Negative_regulation downregulate <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Negative_regulation downregulate <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Cause destabilization <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme interleukin-1 beta <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Negative_regulation destabilization <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme interleukin-1 beta <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Transcription preformed <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme interleukin-1 beta <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: Now we have examined the effect of the nature of the monocyte activating signal on these two inhibitory mechanims .

When human monocytes were preincubated with dexamethasone for 1 hour and then stimulated either with bacterial lipopolysaccharide or phorbol myristate , it was found that dexamethasone inhibited the lipopolysaccharide - induced <extra_id_0> interleukin-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein production , but the phorbol myristate - induced production was increased 3-10 fold .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Negative_regulation inhibited <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme induced <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation induced <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Gene_expression production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme interleukin-1 beta <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation induced <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme production <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation increased <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme induced <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: This difference was also seen at the mRNA level .

When dexamethasone was added to the cultures 3 hours after the stimulators , it clearly decreased the <extra_id_0> interleukin-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels regardless of the stimulator used ( although the effect was clearly weaker on the PMA - induced mRNA ) .

text: Thus these data suggest that the phorbol myristate - induced signal ( prolonged protein kinase C activation ? )
can not be inhibited by prior incubation with dexamethasone and it also protects the induced mRNA for the degradative action of dexamethasone .
